attributes.action: House of Lords agree to a pay cut during COVID-19 crisis.
attributes.additional_details: Reduce costs to show solidarity with the British public. Everyone is doing there bit for the country, the Lords should too.
attributes.background: Have the House of Lords agree a 50% pay cut during covid-19 crisis.

rejection.details:
The attendance allowance paid to members of the House of Lords is a matter for the House of Lords, and not the Government or House of Commons. You can find out more about allowances for Members of the House of Lords here: https://www.parliament.uk/about/mps-and-lords/about-lords/lords-allowances/

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
